Waani Toss wrote:

> Starts a program
> Checks if the program has started properly(check the
> log book)
> Stops the program

Just write all this as a Java method inside a class extending TestCase. 
Now name that method

public void testProgramStarted() {
     // your code
}

There is no need--yet--for suite(), setUp() or tearDown(). Instead, just 
do one thing at a time.

Now run the Test Runner on your test.

> I am very new to Junit, as well as java programming. 

How many tutorials have you read? I recommend using keywords like "JUnit 
guide" in Google and reading what you find.
